## 2025 book stats

### genre stats
```{python}
#| label: genre-stats
#| fig-cap: "% fiction and non-fiction reads this year"

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

# updated 5-12-25
fiction = 7
nonfiction = 3

## make pie chart
labels = ['fiction', 'non-fiction']
num = [fiction, nonfiction]
colors = ['#56505d', '#df3a26']

plt.pie(num, labels=labels, colors=colors, autopct='%1.0f%%')
plt.show()
```


### books by month
```{python}

import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
import pandas as pd
import seaborn as sns
import plotly.express as px


months = ['jan 25', 'feb 25', 'mar 25', 'apr 25', 'may 25']
counts = [1, 2, 1, 5, 1]

d = {'month': months, 'books': counts}


df = pd.DataFrame(data=d)


# fig, ax = plt.subplots()
# ax.plot(months, counts, '#df3a26', **{'marker': 'o'})
# ax.set_xlabel('month')
# ax.set_ylabel('# books read')
# plt.show()

fig = px.line(df, x="month", y="books", title='books read by month', markers=True)
fig.show()

```
